0.title: Voting begins to elect Congress' next chief between Mallikarjun Kharge & Shashi Tharoor
0.article_body: Voting for the Congress presidential elections began at 10 am today. The fate of the Congress party will be decided by over 9,000 Pradesh Congress Committee delegates who comprise the electoral college for electing the next party chief between Mallikarjun Kharge and Shashi Tharoor. Sonia Gandhi and Manmohan Singh will vote in Delhi, while Rahul Gandhi will vote in Karnataka.

1.title: India reports 2,060 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 26,834
1.article_body: India reported 2,060 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. The active cases in India now stand at 26,834. The data showed that 1,841 people recovered in the last 24 hours. The recovery rate in the country currently stands at 98.75%. The COVID-19 death toll so far has reached  5,28,905.

2.title: Activists set off fire alarm to disrupt German Chancellor's speech
2.article_body: Environmentalist group, Scientist Rebellion, said on Sunday that its activists set off the fire alarm to interrupt German Chancellor Olaf Scholz's speech at World Health Summit in Berlin. It added that this was done to "draw particular attention to the climate failure of the German government". Some of the group's members also glued their hands to the ground in protest.

3.title: Delhi's air quality slips to 'poor' category; AQI rises to 201
3.article_body: The air quality in the national capital on Monday morning was recorded in 'poor' category as the Air Quality Index (AQI) touched 201, data by SAFAR showed. The air quality is expected to remain in 'poor' category for the next few days, experts warned. The last time Delhi's air deteriorated to the 'poor' category was on October 5, said reports.

4.title: Kohli's form will unleash in a big way in T20 WC: Ex-player Reetinder Sodhi
4.article_body: Ex-India all-rounder Reetinder Singh Sodhi has backed Virat Kohli to "score big" in the ongoing 2022 T20 World Cup in Australia. "Big players deliver in important tournaments. It often happens with Kohli," stated Sodhi. Kohli was India's highest-run scorer in the 2022 Asia Cup and has scored 115 runs in his last three T20I innings.

5.title: Students allege harassment at Miranda House fest, share videos of men climbing walls
5.article_body: Students of Delhi's all-women Miranda House alleged they were harassed after men forcibly entered the college to attend a Diwali fest on campus. Several students took to social media to share videos and pictures of men climbing the college's walls and gates. "Cat-calling, groping, sexist sloganeering...Men entering safe spaces to harass gender minorities is nothing new," a student wrote.

6.title: Dr Dilip Mahalanabis, pioneer of oral rehydration therapy, passes away aged 87
6.article_body: Eminent paediatrician Dr Dilip Mahalanabis has passed away at the age of 87, hospital authorities said. He was undergoing treatment for lung infection and other old-age ailments at a private hospital in Kolkata. Dr Mahalanabis was known for pioneering the use of oral rehydration therapy during the outbreak of cholera among refugees of the 1971 Bangladesh Liberation War.

7.title: Pune Crime Branch arrests gangster Gajanan in extortion case
7.article_body: The Anti Extortion Cell (AEC) of the Pune Crime Branch arrested gangster Gajanan from Satara in connection with an extortion case. According to police, he had kidnapped a businessman who had invested in shares and tried to extort â‚¹20 crore from him. A total of 14 people have been booked in the case.

8.title: 11-month-old girl dies as mom attempts suicide with her in Maharashtra lake
8.article_body: An 11-month-old girl died after her mother attempted suicide by jumping into a lake in Maharashtra's Nagpur. The 38-year-old woman was rescued by people while the infant drowned. The mother and the infant were rushed to the hospital where the baby was declared dead. The incident took place around 4:30 pm on Saturday.

9.title: Manish Sisodia writes to LG, says Delhi has become the crime capital
9.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia wrote a letter to LG Vinai Kumar Saxena and claimed that the national capital has become the crime capital. "Criminals have no fear...The Constitution has given you the responsibility to maintain law and order in Delhi. The police reports directly to you. I request you to give some attention to this," wrote Sisodia.

10.title: I've legit nightmares that it's been stolen: Dulquer on his BMW M3 E46 car
10.article_body: Actor Dulquer Salmaan opened up about one of his "beloved" cars, BMW M3 E46, and shared that he has "legit nightmares that it's been stolen, vandalised". "I am really protective of this car," he shared in a video. Reportedly, Dulquer also owns a Ferrari 458 Spider, BMW X6 M, Porsche Panamera Turbo, Mercedes - AMG G63, and Volkswagen Polo GTI.

11.title: 14-yr-old fakes kidnapping in Maha to avoid mother's questions over studies
11.article_body: A 14-year-old girl ran away from home and later told a fake story of her kidnapping to avoid questions about her studies in Maharashtra's Nagpur. "The girl [wanted] to get rid of constant nagging by her mother," said police. The girl claimed that she was kidnapped by two women while the CCTV showed her boarding a bus on her own.

12.title: First case of new Omicron sub-variant BF.7 found in India
12.article_body: Gujarat Biotechnology Research Centre has detected the first case of the Omicron sub-variant BF.7 in India. Dr Madhavi Joshi, senior scientist at Gujarat Biotechnology Research Centre told Mint that panic should not be created and requested people to wear masks, avoid gathering and follow hand hygiene. Notably, two new Omicron sub-variants BF.7 and BA.5.1.7 were recently detected in China.

13.title: Not everybody is a fit for our culture: Ola CEO on his management style
13.article_body: When asked about his management style at the company, Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal remarked, "Not everybody is a fit for our culture". Around 36 employees at Ola Electric and ANI Technologies, reportedly quit within a year or two of joining. A report quoting Ola Electric employees said Aggarwal would call staff "useless" or lose patience in meetings over minor issues.

14.title: When we talk of corruption-free TN, we can't trust DMK govt: Piyush Goyal
14.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal said the DMK government in Tamil Nadu is involved in corruption and ignored the development of the poor. "When we talk of corruption-free Tamil Nadu, we cannot trust the governmentâ€¦[It is] not taking up the developmental works for the poor but doing the development work for their son and son-in-law," Goyal added.

15.title: 3 of a family dead after suffering burns due to firecracker explosion in Gurugram
15.article_body: Three members of a family died after they suffered severe burn injuries in a firecrackers explosion at their home in a village in Gurugram last week, the police said. Six people, including four members of Bhagwan Das' family, were critically injured in the explosion. Bhagwan Das used to supply firecrackers for use in weddings and other functions, the police said.

16.title: No problem with Congress' ideology: Tharoor ahead of party's chief poll
16.article_body: Congress Presidential poll candidate Shashi Tharoor on Sunday said he finds no problem with his party's ideology. "I want to bring a change in our way of working. My contender Mallikarjun Kharge is an experienced leader, if he wins, we will work in cooperation naturally," Tharoor added. The Congress Presidential poll is scheduled to be held on Monday.

17.title: Will bear treatment cost: Punjab minister after her escort vehicle hits 2
17.article_body: After her escort vehicle hit two people in Chandigarh, Punjab Cabinet Minister Dr Baljit Kaur said that she will bear all costs of their treatment. She said that the security personnel who were in the vehicle had taken the injured to the hospital on her request as the ambulance was taking time to reach.

18.title: Guardiola claims Liverpool fans threw coins at him, says 'they tried, but didn't get me'
18.article_body: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola has said coins were thrown at him from the stands during their match against Liverpool, which they lost 0-1 on Sunday. The incident reportedly happened after Guardiola reacted angrily to Phil Foden's goal being disallowed following a VAR check in the second half. "All these coins, they tried, but didn't get [me]," said Guardiola.

19.title: Activists pour out milk in shopping aisles in various stores in UK, videos surface
19.article_body: Several anti-dairy activists were seen pouring milk in supermarket aisles and displays across different department stores in the UK to bring attention to their cause. Videos that surfaced on social media showed members of Animal Rebellion, a climate change and animal rights organisation, participating in this at UK stores such as Whole Foods and Marks and Spencer.

20.title: Irrfan Khan's son Babil makes runway debut at Lakme Fashion Week
20.article_body: Late actor Irrfan Khan's son Babil Khan made his runway debut at the Lakme Fashion Week on Sunday. Babil, who is making his Bollywood debut with 'Qala', walked the ramp for designer Pawan Sachdeva. Mrunal Thakur was designer Rajesh Pratap Singh's showstopper at the finale show of Lakme Fashion Week. Yami Gautam, Bhagyashree, and others also walked the ramp.

21.title: Group allegedly trespasses on mosque land, performs rituals in Hyd
21.article_body: A group belonging to a particular community allegedly trespassed on Hyderabad's Qutb Shahi mosque land and performed rituals. A video of the incident has surfaced online. Several Muslim people staged a protest following the incident. "The other group is claiming...government had allocated some land there for a temple...On Monday, we expect the issue to be resolved," a police official said.

22.title: Protests in Delhi's Ranjit Nagar after 3 men kill 27-yr-old man, RAF deployed
22.article_body: After three men allegedly killed a 27-year-old man in Delhi's Ranjit Nagar area, local politicians called for a protest on Sunday. The protest was also joined by the deceased's family and supporters. Rapid Action Force companies have been deployed in the area to maintain security, reports said. Police said that they are verifying the sequence of the incident.

23.title: Declared minor after 33 years of trial, Bihar farmer acquitted 10 years later
23.article_body: A 56-year-old Bihar farmer, who was booked in 1979 along with nine others including his father under IPC sections 148 (rioting armed with deadly weapon) and 307 (attempt to murder), has been acquitted. Munna Singh faced trial as an adult for 33 years before it was decided in 2012 that he was a minor at the time of the incident.

24.title: Central Railway to get its sixth air-conditioned local train in Mumbai soon
24.article_body: The Central Railway (CR) will get its sixth air-conditioned (AC) local train in Mumbai soon as a 12-car rake has been already dispatched for Mumbai from Chennai's coach factory. The new AC rake is expected to arrive in a couple of days, after which its commissioning process will start, which will likely take one month, a senior rail official said.

25.title: 2 labourers die while cleaning septic tank at house in Ghaziabad
25.article_body: Two labourers died while cleaning a septic tank at a house in Ghaziabad on Sunday, police said. One of the workers fell unconscious on entering the tank, following which the second worker entered the tank to rescue him but he also collapsed, police added. The labourers were taken to a hospital but were declared dead on arrival, the SHO said.

26.title: Conjunctivitis cases on rise in Mumbai due to changing weather: BMC
26.article_body: Number of conjunctivitis cases are increasing in Mumbai over the past two weeks due to changing weather, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) said. People must take precautions and timely visit doctors in case they experience pain or discomfort in their eyes, the BMC added. In the last two weeks, 250-300 conjunctivitis patients have been treated in the civic-run hospital.

27.title: Ola CEO called teams 'useless', hurled Punjabi epithets at staff in meetings: Report
27.article_body: Several former and current employees at Ola Electric have alleged that the company's culture has turned hostile over the last couple of years, Bloomberg reported. They accused Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal of directing Punjabi epithets at staff and calling teams "useless" in meetings. Aggarwal would lose patience over a crooked paper clip or quality of printing paper, the employees claimed.

28.title: Pune woman looks for overseas job for her brother, loses â‚¹8.20 lakh
28.article_body: A 23-year-old woman in Pune lost â‚¹8.20 lakh while looking for an overseas job opportunity for her brother. A Mumbai-based man had promised to help her to get a job in Scotland. The woman had met the accused during a train journey in 2019. The accused stopped taking her calls after she paid the money to him, reports said.

29.title: Activists spray orange paint on luxury car showroom in London, video surfaces
29.article_body: Activists of 'Just Stop Oil' on Sunday sprayed orange paint on an Aston Martin dealership in London after blocking Park Lane. The incident took place at around 11 am on Sunday when the group blocked the four-lane road alongside Hyde Park and vandalised the dealership. Around 11 people were arrested for obstructing the highway and one for criminal damage.

30.title: OPEC+ members endorse oil production cut after allegations from US
30.article_body: OPEC+ member states came forward to endorse the decision to cut oil production in wake of the US claiming that OPEC+ nations were being pushed by Saudi Arabia into the move. Iraq said the decision was based on economic indicators. Oman and Bahrain also released separate statements that the decision on the 2 million barrels per day reduction was unanimous.

31.title: More than 1.5 mn people have applied for FIFA World Cup passes: Qatar
31.article_body: Qatar said anywhere between 1.5 million and 1.7 million people have applied for compulsory FIFA World Cup pass. The card acts as a visa, match ticket and transportation ticket, and gives access to some fan zones. All travellers to Qatar will need the pass to enter the country from November 1, whether they intend to watch a game or not.

32.title: Should have listened to Russell during Japanese GP: Mercedes F1
32.article_body: Mercedes F1 trackside engineer Andrew Shovlin said the team agrees with driver George Russell that they should not have pitted him at the same time as Lewis Hamilton during the Japanese GP. "We should have done what George was asking, which was to give him the lap in clean air," said Shovlin. Russell finished eighth due to Mercedes' strategy error.

33.title: Tamil Nadu records 279 COVID-19 cases, no deaths in 24 hours
33.article_body: Tamil Nadu reported 279 new cases of COVID-19 in the last 24 hours, the health department informed on Sunday. The state capital, Chennai, recorded the maximum number of new cases with 67 people testing positive for the infection, the daily COVID-19 bulletin said. No new deaths due to the infection were recorded. Tamil Nadu's active case count stood at 4,115.

34.title: Started debt restructuring talks with the IMF, India and China: Sri Lankan President
34.article_body: Sri Lankan President Ranil Wickremesinghe said the nation has begun debt restructuring talks with the IMF, India and China for overcoming its economic crisis. Wickremesinghe said talks have also started with private creditors. He said the funds from World Bank, Asian Development Bank, the US and the EU were being used to pay for the medicine and fertiliser imports.

35.title: West Bengal invites bids to set up 205 EV charging, battery swapping stations
35.article_body: The West Bengal State Electricity Distribution Company Ltd (WBSEDCL) has invited expressions of interest to install 205 charging or battery-swapping stations for electric vehicles. An official said that the infrastructure would be established in public-private partnership (PPP). WBSEDCL said the stations would be installed on its land but maintained by operators who will offer a share of revenue.

36.title: Man Utd-Newcastle match ends in 0-0 draw as Ronaldo's goal ruled offside
36.article_body: Manchester United and Newcastle's Premier League match ended 0-0, ensuring both teams stayed in the table's top six. "We've had our moments and chances today. I'm very proud of our players," said Newcastle manager Eddie Howe after the match. United's Cristiano Ronaldo had a goal ruled offside while Newcastle forward Joelinton's doubleheader hit the crossbar and then the post.

37.title: Lebanon accuses Israeli gunboats of violating territorial waters
37.article_body: The Lebanese army on Sunday alleged that Israeli gunboats entered Lebanon's territorial waters several times on Saturday in an area opposite Ras Naqura. Lebanese authorities said there were four instances of maritime border violations by the gunboats, adding that they were discussing the violations with a United Nations Interim Force. The Israeli military has denied the allegations.

38.title: 2 Karnataka Bank DBUs commence operations
38.article_body: Two digital banking units (DBUs) of Karnataka Bank started operations on Sunday, after Prime Minister Narendra Modi dedicated 75 DBUs to the nation. The two DBUs started operations at Airport Road, Yeyyadi in Mangaluru and Vijayanagara 1st Stage in Mysuru, the bank said. CEO and Chairman MS Mahabaleshwara called the recognition special as the bank steps into its centenary year.

39.title: Haaland fails to score for 1st time in PL as Man City lose against Liverpool
39.article_body: Erling Haaland failed to score for Manchester City for the first time in 10 Premier League matches as they lost to Liverpool 0-1 at Anfield on Sunday. Mohamed Salah scored the lone goal in 76th minute. It's Manchester City's first Premier League defeat of the season. They're now four points behind leaders Arsenal, while Liverpool are eighth in the standings.

40.title: 2 hovercraft ships of Coast Guard sent to Indo-Pak border in Guj
40.article_body: The Indian Coast Guard sent two hovercraft ships from Mangaluru to the India-Pakistan border in Gujarat, Coast Guard Commander (West Zone) Manoj V Badkar said. He added that there is a pressing need for hovercrafts in Gujarat rather than in Mangaluru. India has 18 hovercrafts and Badkar said once the number increases they might be brought back to Mangaluru.

41.title: Biden will act 'methodically' in responding to Saudi Arabia: Sullivan
41.article_body: US President Joe Biden will act "methodically" in deciding the nature of the response to Saudi Arabia's decision of reducing oil production, the US National Security Adviser said on Sunday. The options do, however, include changes to US security assistance, Jake Sullivan added. OPEC+ countries led by Russia and Saudi Arabia declared oil output cuts despite US objections last week.

42.title: Tharoor slams 'netagiri' by colleagues ahead of Cong Prez polls
42.article_body: On the eve of the Congress Presidential polls, Shashi Tharoor, who is contesting against Mallikarjun Kharge, criticised 'netagiri' by his colleagues. "I know that some of my colleagues are indulging in 'netagiri' and telling the party workers that they know what Sonia Gandhi wants and whom she wants," Tharoor said. He added that the Gandhis made their neutrality categorically clear.

43.title: 3 members of a family killed in car-truck collision in UP's Jhansi
43.article_body: Three members of a family were killed when a truck hit their car in UP's Jhansi district in the early hours of Sunday, police said. Another three people, including the car driver, were injured in the accident, as per the police. The deceased include Mohar Singh (65), his wife Malti (62) and his daughter Anita (32), news agency PTI reported.

44.title: Incredible team, effort: Smriti on India's record 7th Women's Asia Cup title
44.article_body: Praising India following their record-extending seventh Women's Asia Cup title, vice-captain Smriti Mandhana took to Twitter and wrote, "Incredible team. Incredible effort. A seventh Asia Cup for India. Can't wait to win many more with this bunch." With an unbeaten 51 runs off 25 balls, Smriti top-scored in the match. India beat Sri Lanka by eight wickets on Saturday.

45.title: Global Hunger Index publishers are 'defaming' India: RSS affiliate
45.article_body: Calling the 2022 Global Hunger Index report "irresponsible and mischievous", the Swadeshi Jagran Manch (SJM) said that the publishers of the report are "defaming" India and have demanded that the Centre take action against them. The SJM, an RSS affiliate, also called the report "far from reality". India ranked 107 out of 121 countries on the Global Hunger Index.

46.title: Leopard dies after being hit by vehicle in Maharashtra's Amravati
46.article_body: A male leopard died after being hit by an unknown vehicle in the Amravati district of Maharashtra. The incident occurred at around 4.30 am at Rahatgaon-Badnera bypass, a forest official said. The deceased male leopard was around four to five years old and a case has been registered against an unidentified person by the forest department.

47.title: 4 injured as strikes hit Russian region bordering Ukraine: Guv
47.article_body: At least four people were injured after Russia's Belgorod region bordering Ukraine was hit by strikes on Sunday, Russian officials said. The city of Belgorod witnessed around 16 explosions, Russiaâ€™s investigative committee, which probes serious crimes, said on Sunday. Russia last week reported an alleged rise in artillery and missile strikes on its territories bordering Ukraine.

48.title: Real Madrid defeat BarÃ§a 3-1 in season's 1st El Clasico, top La Liga table
48.article_body: Karim Benzema, Federico Valverde and Rodrygo each scored a goal as Real Madrid defeated Barcelona 3-1 in the season's first El Clasico. With this, Real Madrid took over from Barcelona as the La Liga table toppers with a three-point lead. Barcelona's Ferran Torres scored a goal in the 83rd minute while Real Madrid's Rodrygo converted a penalty in stoppage time.

49.title: Boat carrying labourers capsizes in Bihar, 7 killed
49.article_body: A boat capsized in Bihar's Katihar and claimed the lives of seven people, according to an official. Udayan Mishra, District Magistrate of Katihar, said that the bodies were taken out during an overnight rescue operation conducted by local divers and NDRF personnel. Chief Minister Nitish Kumar announced ex-gratia of â‚¹4 lakh for the family of each of the deceased.

50.title: England have got 'mojo back' ahead of T20 WC: Coach Matthew Mott
50.article_body: England's white-ball coach Matthew Mott said that the side has got their "mojo back" ahead of the T20 World Cup. "There's a number of teams that are potential winners of this WC, of which we're one," Mott said. He added, "I think we're in a pretty good spot at the moment...[and] we don't want to be...predictable [in the tournament]."

51.title: ICC names India's predicted playing XI for T20 World Cup 2022
51.article_body: ICC, on its official website, named Team India's predicted playing XI for T20 World Cup 2022. ICC chose Dinesh Karthik as India's wicketkeeper and number six batter in the playing XI instead of Rishabh Pant. Other players include Rohit Sharma (captain), KL Rahul, Virat Kohli, Suryakumar Yadav, Hardik Pandya, Axar Patel, Harshal Patel, Bhuvneshwar Kumar, Yuzvendra Chahal and Arshdeep Singh.

52.title: How much prize money did the Women's Asia Cup 2022 winners and runners-up get?
52.article_body: India, who won Women's Asia Cup for a record-extending seventh time, received a total prize money of $20,000. Meanwhile, Sri Lanka, who finished runners-up, won a prize money of $12,500. India fast bowler Renuka Singh won a prize money of $1,000 for being the Player of the Match in the final. Meanwhile, Player of the Tournament Deepti Sharma got $2,000.

53.title: Salman is a brilliant human being, respects women on set: Choreographer Shabina
53.article_body: Choreographer Shabina Khan, speaking about working with Salman Khan, said the actor gives a lot of respect to women on sets. "He's such a brilliant human being [who] started calling me ma'am when I turned dance master," she said, adding, "I requested him not to call me ma'am...but he said...others will address me in the same way that he does."

54.title: Airlines should maintain 4-6 months of cash reserves: CAPA South Asia CEO
54.article_body: Global aviation and consultancy firm CAPA's CEO for South Asia Kapil Kaul urged for a policy to ensure that Indian airlines have cash reserves of four-six months for continuity of operations. The firm estimated that this fiscal, the domestic airline industry could incur losses of about $1.4-1.7 billion. "COVID-19 had an unprecedented impact on the sector," he added.

55.title: US embassy in India releases over 1 lakh work visa appointments for H&L categories
55.article_body: The US embassy in India has announced the release of over 1 lakh work visa appointments for the H&L workers and their families, in view of the "high demand for employment-based visas". "This...reflects our ongoing commitment to H&L workers," it said. The wait time for both interview waiver and first-time appointments has been "cut in half", it added.

56.title: OPEC+ decisions based on economic indicators: Iraq's oil marketing firm
56.article_body: Iraq's Oil Marketing Company SOMO has said that OPEC+ decisions are based on economic indicators. "There's...consensus among OPEC+ countries that the best approach in dealing with the oil market conditions...is a pre-emptive approach that supports market stability and provides the future the guidance it needs," it said. OPEC+ ministers have agreed to cut oil production by two million barrels/day.

57.title: To eternity we go: Kareena to Saif on their 10th wedding anniversary
57.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor Khan took to Instagram and shared old pictures with her husband and actor Saif Ali Khan on their 10th wedding anniversary. Along with the pictures, she wrote, "Me and you. You and Me. To eternity we go...Happy 10 Handsome Man." Reacting to the post, Malaika Arora commented, "Happy anniversary my loves."

58.title: Karan's directorial debut 'Kuch Kuch...' completes 24 yrs, filmmaker pens note
58.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar took to Instagram to celebrate 24 years of his directorial debut 'Kuch Kuch Hota Hai'. "Time flies...but 'Kuch Kuch Hota Hai' will always remain special," he wrote, adding, "My first film!!! Made with my best people, best team...thank you for still making it 'pop' in pop culture even 24 years down the line and keeping it 'cool'."

59.title: Wanted to prove star kids aren't dumb dropouts: Tusshar on writing a book
59.article_body: Tusshar Kapoor, when asked what propelled him to write a book, said, "After my son came into my life, everybody...would ask me: How do you manage? So, I decided to publish...book on [it]." He added, "Besides, the general perception is that star kids are dumb drop-outs, who can hardly string two words together and I wanted to prove...that's not true."

60.title: Let me know what you think of Black Adam: Dwayne Johnson to Varun Dhawan
60.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan took to Twitter and said that he is finally going to see his "hero", Dwayne Johnson, back on the big screen with 'Black Adam'. Reacting to Varun's tweet, Dwayne responded, "Thank you my brother! Can't wait for you to see the film...Let me know what you think." 'Black Adam' is directed by Jaume Collet-Serra.

61.title: 3 more Raj students test positive for hepatitis; tally rises to 44
61.article_body: Three more students of a coaching institute in Rajasthan's Kota have tested positive for hepatitis A, taking the number of those affected by the liver disease to 44. The Kota district administration has submitted a report regarding such cases to the Chief Minister's Office, three days after a NEET aspirant died from the infection during treatment.

62.title: Gujarat wants 'new engine government' not 'double-engine' one: Kejriwal
62.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said that Gujarat wants a "new engine government" instead of the "double-engine government". Addressing a rally in Bhavnagar, CM Kejriwal said, "the double-engine is very old, both engines are 40-50 years old...Try for the new party, you do not lose anything for trying." Notably, the "double-engine government" phrase is regularly used by BJP leaders.

63.title: Student misdirected in religion's name: Bihar principal on hijab row
63.article_body: After a college student in Bihar's Muzaffarpur alleged that a male teacher made objectionable remarks when she refused to take off her hijab, the principal said it seems that somebody has misdirected her in the name of religion and hijab. "It's shocking that a Class 11 girl will behave like this," the principal added. Students protested over the issue.

64.title: Sarayu river floods several areas in UP's Gorakhpur
64.article_body: The Sarayu river has flooded several areas of Gola and Barhalganj tehsils in Uttar Pradesh's Gorakhpur district. As many as 296 boats are carrying out the relief work and Prayagraj district officials have been asked to send 12 motor boats to the region. Neighbouring Azamgarh and Deoria districts in UP have also been affected by the flooded river.

65.title: Unverified news on Ankita murder case will prompt action: Police
65.article_body: Head of SIT investigating the Ankita Bhandari murder case, DIG P Renuka Devi, said legal action will be taken against any person or portal airing news about the probe without an official statement. "This is affecting the law and order of the state," said Devi. She added that all facts of the case would be presented in court.

66.title: Turkey denies involvement with migrant incident at Greek border
66.article_body: The Turkish government has denied its involvement in an incident where Greece found 92 illegal migrants near its border with Turkey. The migrants were discovered naked and with injuries on their bodies, Greece had said on Saturday. The Greek government later said the migrants' accounts suggested that they had been forced to enter Greece by the Turkish military police.

67.title: Apple working on dock to turn iPad into smart display: Report
67.article_body: Apple is working on a new dock for the iPad which will allow it to function as smart display and a speaker, according to a report. It is looking to make the tablet similar to an Amazon Echo Show-like device that can be put atop a counter, the report added. The docking station will allow hands-free management of home devices.

68.title: Video shows massive fire engulfing 24-storey skyscraper in Istanbul
68.article_body: Footage of a massive fire that tore through every floor of a 24-storey building in Istanbul has gone viral online. Skies in the area can be seen covered in thick black smoke from the blaze reported in Turkey's capital city. A fire had broken out in the same area due to a gas leak recently, killing three people.

69.title: Top seed Rublev wins inaugural Gijon Open for his 4th title of 2022
69.article_body: Top seed Andrey Rublev defeated unseeded Sebastian Korda 6-2, 6-3 in the Gijon Open final to win his fourth title of the season on Sunday. The world number nine beat Ilya Ivashka, Tommy Paul and US Open 2020 champion Dominic Thiem en route to the final of the inaugural tournament. Overall, it was Rublev's 12th ATP title in men's singles.

70.title: Heavy to very heavy rainfall warning issued for several states, list released
70.article_body: The IMD, in its latest bulletin, stated that heavy to very heavy rainfall is very likely over Andaman & Nicobar Islands, Kerala, Tamil Nadu and Puducherry from October 17 to October 20. Further, it's very likely over Maharashtra and Goa on October 17, over Karnataka on October 17 and October 20, and over Lakshadweep from October 18 to October 20.

71.title: Bilkis Bano case about us all, the schizophrenic society we are: Moitra
71.article_body: TMC MP Mahua Moitra said the release of the 11 convicts in the 2002 Bilkis Bano case is about all of us, "the schizophrenic society that we are". "The law...allowed these men to walk free, but the people...celebrated these men with tilaks, ladoos and garlands. This [speaks volumes of] mindset of India's current citizens, which...is far more worrying," Moitra added.

72.title: Man pushed out of moving train after fight in Bengal; injured
72.article_body: A man was injured after being pushed out of a moving train in West Bengal's Birbhum district by a fellow passenger following an argument. The man was rescued and taken to a hospital where his condition was stated to be stable. One person was arrested, while the police suspected the involvement of more persons in the crime.

73.title: Salman Khan consumes drugs, don't know about Aamir Khan: Baba Ramdev
73.article_body: While launching a movement against drugs, Baba Ramdev, at an event alleged that actor Salman Khan consumes drugs, adding that he doesn't know whether Aamir Khan also consumes drugs. He also recalled the Mumbai cruise drugs case involving Shah Rukh Khan's son Aryan Khan. "We should take a resolution that India must be free from every drug addiction," he stated.

74.title: UP Police salutes K9 dog for helping solve murder case in 48 hours
74.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh Police on Sunday saluted a K9 dog for helping trace a suspect in a murder case within 48 hours. A 15-year-old boy was murdered and his body was buried at a farm in Kasganj, police said. Not only did the ace detective reach the killers, but also tracked a looted tractor parked 22 kilometres away, police added.

75.title: Abdu's popularity didn't come as surprise: Bigg Boss 16's Sreejita
75.article_body: 'Bigg Boss 16' contestant Sreejita De, who was evicted from the show, has said that Abdu Rozik's popularity did not come as a surprise for her. "I liked him within 1-2 days. He is very genuine, cute and pure-hearted. I wish I had come on another season due to Abdu's popularity and him getting all the attention," she added.

76.title: Punjab court summons Finance Minister Cheema in defamation case
76.article_body: A court in Punjab's Moga has summoned the state's Finance Minister Harpal Singh Cheema on November 15 in an alleged defamation case filed by ex-MLA Harjot Kamal. Kamal, who switched to BJP from Congress earlier this year, has alleged that Cheema dragged his name in the alleged land acquisition scam of highway number 105-B.

77.title: Brazil have great chance of winning FIFA World Cup 2022: Cafu
77.article_body: Brazil have a great chance of winning the FIFA World Cup in Qatar this year, said former Brazilian footballer Cafu. "Brazil today are much more prepared and experienced. The team does not depend exclusively on a single player. Instead we have a group that makes him (Neymar Jr) stand out," he added. World Cup will begin on November 20.

78.title: 38-yr-old UP BJP leader killed as car collides with pick-up vehicle
78.article_body: A member of Uttar Pradesh BJP's Meerut district unit working committee was killed and four others were injured after a speeding car in which they were travelling collided with a pick-up vehicle on Sunday. The 38-year-old BJP leader, Gaurav Chauhan, was declared dead at a primary health centre. All others injured were sent to a higher health centre for treatment.

79.title: India may become 3rd biggest economy behind US & China by FY28: Report
79.article_body: According to IMF World Economic Outlook database, India could overtake Germany and Japan and become the third biggest economy globally. The top two economies will continue to be the United States and China, Economic Times reported. Notably on Saturday, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said that Indian economy is projected to grow at 7% in the current fiscal despite global headwinds.

80.title: A film's language should be where the story is set: Gul Panag
80.article_body: Actress Gul Panag has said, "Films should be made in the language which is most natural to where the story is set." She questioned why Shah Rukh Khan-starrer 'Veer-Zaara' was not made in Punjabi. Gul added that language is a secondary part of filmmaking and stated that the primary part is to be authentic to the story.

81.title: I miss Rishi Kapoor on social media, he was very funny: Karan
81.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar said in an interview that he misses Rishi Kapoor on social media. He added that the late actor was very funny and "so amazingly candid". "Every time I feel like...industry is going through some turbulence I'm like 'If Chintu ji was here, he would have really given a good, kadak (solid) jawab (answer) to many...people'," said Karan.

82.title: Tremendous start to T20 WC 2022: Bishop after Namibia's win over Sri Lanka
82.article_body: Reacting to Namibia's win over Sri Lanka in T20 World Cup 2022, Ian Bishop tweeted, "Tremendous start to T20 World Cup 2022. Biggest take-down of Gerhard Erasmus and Namibia crickets journey so far." Ex-South African cricketer Albie Morkel said, "This is what dreams are made of. Amazing day. Well done champs." Robin Uthappa wrote on Twitter, "Phenomenal performance by Namibia."

83.title: Bihar girl asked to remove hijab during exam, creates 'ruckus'; college responds
83.article_body: A college student in Bihar's Muzaffarpur has alleged that a male teacher passed objectionable comments after he asked her to remove her hijab during an exam and she refused. She reportedly claimed the teacher called her an "anti-national". "She was...asked to reveal her ears since there were apprehensions that she might be carrying a Bluetooth device," the college's Principal said.

84.title: I still feel I have a long way to go: Rakul on her journey in film industry
84.article_body: Actress Rakul Preet Singh, speaking about her journey in the film industry, said, "I still feel I have a long way to go and there's a lot more, I am hungry [for] more work." "But at the same time, I am extremely thankful because this journey has only been possible due to the love of the audience," she added.

85.title: 75 digital banking units set up in record 6 months: RBI Governor
85.article_body: As PM Narendra Modi on Sunday dedicated 75 Digital Banking Units (DBUs) to the nation, RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das said these DBUs were set up in a record six months in 75 districts spread across the country to commemorate 75 years of independence. "It is a special banking facility that'll provide maximum services through minimum digital infrastructure," he added.

86.title: WSJ ad seeks sanctions against FM Sitharaman & top Indian officials, govt reacts
86.article_body: The Ministry of Information and Broadcasting has reacted after a full-page advertisement in the US newspaper Wall Street Journal (WSJ) called for sanctions against Finance Minister (FM) Nirmala Sitharaman and other senior government officials. "It's a campaign against India's sovereignty," said Ministry advisor Kanchan Gupta. He said fugitive Devas CEO Ramachandra Vishwanathan was behind the ad.

87.title: Darcie Brown bowls fastest delivery in the history of Women's Big Bash League
87.article_body: Adelaide Strikers Women's 19-year-old fast bowler Darcie Brown on Sunday created history by bowling the fastest ever delivery in the history of Women's Big Bash League. Darcie set the record by clocking 127.2 km/h in her first over against Melbourne Renegades Women. Darcie registered figures of 3-0-28-0 in the match.

88.title: Still struggling to process T20 WC win over UAE: Netherlands captain
88.article_body: Netherlands captain Scott Edwards said he is "still struggling to process" the team's last-over win against UAE in the ICC Men's T20 World Cup. "It was nervy...the main thing is relief, getting the tournament underway with a win is the most important," said Edwards. Netherlands chased down 112-run target with one ball and three wickets to spare.

89.title: Nearly 9,000 Russian troops will be stationed in country: Belarus
89.article_body: Belarus's Defence Ministry has said just under 9,000 Russian troops would be stationed in the country as part of a "regional grouping" of forces to protect its borders. "The first convoys of Russian servicemen...have arrived," the ministry said on Saturday. Belarus declared the joint troop deployment last week, saying it was in response to "threats" from Ukraine and the West.

90.title: 'Acche din, oops!' Congress shares parody video mocking PM Modi
90.article_body: Responding to BJP's parody video mocking Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, Congress on Sunday shared a video mocking PM Narendra Modi. In the video, a man can be seen holding a cylinder and crying, referring to the increasing price of gas cylinders. Furthermore, a man criticises PM Modi over the rising prices of fuel in the country in the video.

91.title: Players who test COVID-19 positive will be allowed to play T20 World Cup matches
91.article_body: The ICC confirmed that players who test COVID-19 positive will be permitted to play T20 World Cup 2022 matches. It stated that there will no mandatory testing during the tournament and no isolation period if a player gets COVID-19. Team doctors will assess whether it's appropriate for players to compete if they contract the virus on case to case basis.

92.title: 16-year-old UAE cricketer Aayan falls after tripping over boundary rope, video goes viral
92.article_body: While walking back to the pavilion after getting out against Netherlands in their T20 World Cup 2022 match, UAE's 16-year-old all-rounder Aayan Afzal Khan fell after tripping over the boundary rope. A video of the same went viral. In the video, the spectators sitting near the boundary rope can be seen jumping from their chairs on seeing Aayan fall.

93.title: Asked director, why'd a man wear underpants outside trousers: Brosnan on Batman
93.article_body: Actor Pierce Brosnan revealed that he auditioned for the 1989 film 'Batman', which was directed by Tim Burton. "I remember saying something stupid to Tim Burton. I said, 'You know, I can't understand [why] any man would wear his underpants outside his trousers'," he added. The role was eventually played by Michael Keaton.

94.title: 'Frustration+Desperation= Animation': Cong on BJP video mocking Rahul
94.article_body: Responding to a parody video that mocked Congress Rahul Gandhi, Congress General Secretary in-charge Communications Jairam Ramesh said, "BJP's latest formula to counter the success of the Bharat Jodo Yatra. Frustration + Desperation = Animation." He added, "To call the video they have put out pathetic is an understatement!" The video also took a jibe at Congress' Sonia Gandhi.

95.title: Man using phone while crossing road in UP hit by speeding car; video surfaces
95.article_body: A man in Uttar Pradesh's Bisalpur died after he was hit by a speeding car when he was crossing a road while using his phone. CCTV footage of the incident has surfaced on social media showing the car hitting the man from the back. The youth's family rushed him to a hospital where he was declared brought dead.

96.title: Ukrainian advances repelled in several regions, Russia says
96.article_body: Russia's Defence Ministry on Sunday said that its troops had repelled efforts by Ukrainian forces to make territorial gains in the Donetsk, Kherson and Mykolaiv regions. The ministry also said Russian forces had inflicted what it called significant losses against the enemy. Russia also said it was continuing air strikes on military and energy targets in Ukraine, using precision-guided weapons.

97.title: Finch is a scary proposition for any opposition team: Cummins
97.article_body: Australian pacer Pat Cummins said that batter Aaron Finch is a "scary proposition for any opposition" team. "He's (Finch) got 3,000 T20I runs to his name, and he's still brave enough to take the game on. Big tournament for him I'm sure," Cummins said. Notably, Finch has scored just one fifty in his last 10 T20I games.

98.title: BJP holds '1st ever' Pasmanda Muslims meet in Lucknow
98.article_body: BJP organised a meeting with key members of the Pasmanda Muslim community in Lucknow, UP on Sunday. The party claims that it is the first such meeting ever held by a political party with the Pasmandas. The meet was called the 'Pasmanda Buddhijeevi Sammelan' and was attended by several senior leaders of the party, including UP's Deputy CM Brajesh Pathak.

99.title: UP village head injured, father killed with sticks in dispute
99.article_body: A village head was injured and his 60-year-old father killed after a group of people attacked them over a dispute in Uttar Pradesh's Saharanpur. The duo was attacked with sticks by a dozen men. There was a dispute between both groups over some construction work, but the police pacified them. They came face to face again at night.

100.title: Oil markets going through great fluctuations: OPEC Secretary General
100.article_body: Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) Secretary General Haitham Al Ghais on Sunday that "oil markets are going through a stage of great fluctuations". He further said that the goal of OPEC is to maintain market stability. Notably, OPEC+ has decided to cut oil production by two million barrels a day from November.

101.title: Content produced in OTTs is inclined towards pornography: Govvind
101.article_body: Actor Govvind Namdev has said that the content produced by OTT platforms is more inclined towards pornography as the medium does not have a censor board. "You are openly showing lovemaking, which makes it very uncomfortable for people to watch with family," he added. However, he stated that things are changing as the problems are being addressed.

102.title: 2 killed as car rams into wall in Rajasthan's Nagaur
102.article_body: A car rammed into a wall in Rajasthan's Nagaur district leading to two people getting killed while two others got injured. The deceased have been identified as Virendra Singh (50) and Ramdhan Singh (38) while the injured, Raju Meghwal and Prem Singh, have been admitted to a government hospital, police said. The deceased's bodies were handed over to their relatives.

103.title: UP minister throws mic, tells party workers 'speak if you're a bigger politician'
103.article_body: A video has surfaced online, purportedly showing Uttar Pradesh minister Sanjay Kumar Nishad throwing his microphone on stage after getting angry during a party event in Mau. This came after he reportedly spotted party workers talking among themselves and not paying attention to his speech. "If you are a bigger politician than me, then speak or else listen," he said.

104.title: What are the features of India's first all-aluminium freight rake?
104.article_body: Railways Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw on Sunday flagged off the first indigenously manufactured aluminium goods train rake from Bhubaneswar. It is lighter in weight, demands lower maintenance, has a longer life, promises an 80% resale value and its 180-tonne extra carrying capacity results in higher throughput per wagon. A single aluminium rake in its lifetime saves over 14,500 tonnes of CO2.

105.title: Coal is going to be back as gas has become unaffordable: Sitharaman
105.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said coal is going to be back as gas has become unaffordable and isn't available as much as required. Speaking about an old thermal plant being refurbished to produce electricity in the UK, Sitharaman said, "It is now reviving itself as a thermal unit. So, it's not just India, many countries have gone back."

106.title: K'taka to give â‚¹10 lakh aid to family of girl raped, killed by teacher
106.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai has announced financial aid of â‚¹10 lakh for the family of a 10-year-old girl who was raped and killed by her 51-year-old tuition teacher in the Mandya district. The girl's body was found in the sump of an under-construction building on Thursday. The teacher lured her with chocolates and took her to a deserted area.

107.title: 18-year-old Punjab boy dies of suspected drug overdose, probe on
107.article_body: A day after an 18-year-old boy died of a suspected drug overdose in Punjab's Khadur Sahib village, police have initiated inquest proceedings under CrPC's Section 174. The victim's body was found allegedly in a shrubby area of the village on Saturday. According to his family members, a drug injection was also found intact in the body.

108.title: Forever grateful: Vicky Kaushal on 1 year of 'Sardar Udham'
108.article_body: Actor Vicky Kaushal took to Instagram on Sunday to share a post marking one year since the release of his film 'Sardar Udham'. Sharing a few pictures from the sets, he wrote, "It's been a year. Forever grateful." The film was based on the life of Udham Singh, who assassinated Michael O'Dwyer in revenge for the 1919 Jallianwala Bagh massacre.

109.title: Want to bring change in our way of work: Cong Prez candidate Tharoor
109.article_body: Congress Presidential candidate Shashi Tharoor on Sunday said that his opponent Mallikarjun Kharge is an experienced leader, adding that if Kharge wins the elections, "we'll work in cooperation naturally". "There's no problem with our ideology, but I want to bring a change in our way of work," Tharoor said. The Congress Presidential poll will be held tomorrow, October 17.

110.title: Not every film is made for Oscars: 'Karthikeya 2' actor Nikhil on 'RRR'
110.article_body: 'Karthikeya 2' actor Nikhil Siddhartha, speaking about 'RRR' being submitted to the Oscars for nominations, said the award isn't a certificate. "If you get an Oscar, good, but that shouldn't be the end...Not every film is made for the Oscars," he added. "We have our...National Awards, we have our...Filmfare Awards...many awards are given by our Indian Government," he stated.

111.title: Arsenal vs Leeds suspended for 40 mins due to stadium power surge
111.article_body: Arsenal FC's Premier League match against Leeds United was suspended for nearly 40 minutes after an electrical issue at the Elland Road stadium. A reported 'power surge' at kick-off led to VAR, referee communications and stadium lights being affected. The match was suspended after about three minutes of starting and players were asked to go back to their dressing rooms.

112.title: I enjoyed doing 'Liger', I shot with Mike Tyson: Director Puri Jagannadh
112.article_body: Director Puri Jagannadh said he enjoyed doing 'Liger' with actor Vijay Deverakonda and actress Ananya Panday and building "beautiful" sets. "I shot with Mike Tyson," he added. Puri stated he can't cry over the film's failure for the next three years. "If I look back, the days I was happier are more than the days I was sad," he added.

113.title: Female passengers fight inside Mumbai local, pull each other's hair; video goes viral
113.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media showing female passengers fighting inside a Mumbai local. In the video, the women can be seen punching, slapping and pulling each other's hair. As per reports, the fight occurred between a woman and a mother and daughter duo over occupying a seat.

114.title: Namibia captain reacts to Sachin's tweet on their win vs SL, says 'Nam yaad rakhna'
114.article_body: After Sachin Tendulkar praised Namibia for defeating Sri Lanka in the T20 World Cup 2022 opener, writing, "Namibia...has told the cricketing world today...'Nam' yaad rakhna," Namibia captain Gerhard Erasmus reacted to his tweet. Erasmus wrote, "Nam yaad rakhna!" Namibia defeated Sri Lanka by 55 runs in Geelong.

115.title: People think I'm sitting on pedestal trying to make, break careers: Johar
115.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar, speaking about the misconceptions that people have about him, has said that people think that he is sitting on some pedestal trying to make and break careers. "I'm trying to struggle and survive as much as every other filmmaker. There are enough and more actors that keep saying no to us," he further stated.

116.title: Netherlands defeat UAE by 3 wickets in final-over thriller in T20 WC
116.article_body: Netherlands defeated UAE by three wickets in the final over in their first Group A match in T20 World Cup 2022 in Geelong on Sunday. Batting first, UAE managed 111/8 in 20 overs. Netherlands scored 112/7 in 19.5 overs. Maxwell O'Dowd top-scored for Netherlands with an 18-ball 23. Bas de Leede and Fred Klaassen took three and two wickets respectively.

117.title: Live sports gaming platform PlayCKC raises $200,000 in seed funding
117.article_body: Live sports gaming platform PlayCKC raised $200,000 in a seed funding round led by Freeflow Venture Builders and saw participation from high net worth individuals like Sanjay Nagi and Sharan Parikh. It was founded in 2020 by Swapnil Manish, Anuradha Sinha and Sanket Khemuka. PlayCKC was among four startups in the first sports-tech cohort by India Accelerator and JSW Sports.

118.title: Indian men's 10m air rifle team wins gold at World Shooting Championship
118.article_body: Indian men's 10m air rifle team of Rudrankksh Patil, Arjun Babuta and Kiran Jadhav won the country's fifth gold medal at ISSF World Shooting Championship in Cairo on Sunday. India beat China 16-10 in the gold medal match. Meanwhile, Indian women's 10m air rifle team of Mehuli Ghosh, Elavenil Valarivan and Meghana Sajjanar won bronze medal after defeating Germany 17-11.

119.title: Tiger roaming in Bhopal college campus since 1 week captured
119.article_body: A tiger that had entered the Maulana Azad National Institute of Technology's sprawling campus in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal about a week ago was captured on Sunday, a forest official said. "It walked into one of the three cages put up with baits on the campus. We're going to release the feline in Satpura Tiger Reserve in Narmadapuram," Bhopal DFO said.

120.title: 4 dead, 61 injured in Tehran prison fire: Iranian authorities
120.article_body: Four prisoners were killed and 61 others were injured in the fire that broke out at Tehran's Evin prison on Saturday, Iranian authorities said on Sunday. According to authorities, the fire started after a prison workshop was set ablaze following "a fight among a number of prisoners". Evin reportedly holds many detainees facing security charges, including Iranians with dual nationality.

121.title: Netflix launches 'Basic with Ads' plan with 15 to 30-second-long ads
121.article_body: Netflix has launched a new "Basic with Ads" plan in 12 countries including the US, the UK, Australia, France and Canada. This is Netflix's most affordable monthly plan yet and comes with certain compromises, along with ads. The plan will be available starting November. The ads will last 15-30 seconds and play before and during shows and films.

122.title: U'khand Police on alert as letter threatens to blow up temples
122.article_body: Uttarakhand Police and intelligence agencies have gone on alert after a letter threatened to blow up religious places, including Kedarnath and Badrinath, and railway stations on October 25 and 27. The letter was sent to Haridwar railway station by ordinary post. The writer claimed to be affiliated with Jaish-e-Mohammed and vowed to avenge killing of "jihadis" in Jammu and Kashmir.

123.title: Arjun shares 1st look of Parineeti from 'Uunchai', actress calls him 'asli dost'
123.article_body: Arjun Kapoor on Sunday shared the first look poster of Parineeti Chopra from 'Uunchai'. He wrote, "She was my first heroine and this is her first #Rajshri film...This one is for you Pari!" Parineeti wrote on her Instagram Stories that Arjun launching her poster wasn't a surprise but a "shock" and called him her "sach ka, asli dost (true friend)".

124.title: IBM's Client Innovation Center inaugurated in Odisha by CM Patnaik
124.article_body: Odisha Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik inaugurated IBM's Client Innovation Center (CIC) in Bhubaneswar. Speaking at the inauguration, Patnaik called it a "watershed moment, signifying the fast changing IT ecosystem in the state". He added that Odisha is now fast emerging as a technology resource hub. "Over the years, the resurgent Odisha has scripted success stories in many spheres," Patnaik said.

125.title: Sisodia is less Dy CM & more of Kejriwal's corruption collection agent: BJP
125.article_body: BJP spokesperson Gaurav Bhatia took a jibe at Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia and called him a "corrupt collection agent" of Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal. Bhatia added that Kejriwal should be ashamed of himself for comparing his Ministers with freedom fighters like Bhagat Singh, who sacrificed their lives for the country. He also alleged that AAP was doing "pressure politics".

126.title: I'll have no shame in taking advice of the Gandhi family: Kharge
126.article_body: Congress Presidential candidate Mallikarjun Kharge has said that he'd have no shame in taking the advice of the Gandhi family in running the party affairs. "Sonia Gandhi...[and]...Rahul Gandhi...have done good for [India]...their advice will benefit the party," he said. Kharge was responding to allegations that he would be the remote control of the Gandhi family on becoming the AICC chief.

127.title: 2 refugee camp leaders killed by Rohingya mob in Bangladesh
127.article_body: Two Rohingya refugee camp leaders were lynched to death by a mob of over a dozen Rohingyas in Bangladesh on Saturday, police said. The Arakan Rohingya Salvation Army (ARSA), a group fighting the military in Myanmar, is believed to be behind the killings, an official cited by AFP said. "The internal clashes in Myanmar are impacting the...situation in...camps," he added.

128.title: 68 ATM cards seized after 5 arrested in Guwahati in ATM fraud case
128.article_body: Assam Police has arrested five persons in connection with two ATM fraud cases and has seized 68 ATM cards and three vehicles from them. The accused had fraudulently changed the ATM cards of unknown persons by offering to help them when they went to ATMs to withdraw money, police said. Later, they allegedly withdrew money from the victims' bank accounts.

129.title: Water supply to be disrupted in some parts of Pune for several days
129.article_body: Several parts of Pune will face a disruption in water supply over the next several days due to repair work on the water pipeline between Parvati Water Center and Cantonment Water Center. The city's civic body's Water Supply Department head Aniruddha Pawaskar said that water supply in Hadapsar, Cantonment area, Solapur Road, and Kondhwa neighbourhoods could be affected.

130.title: Putin's chief of Ukraine mobilisation found dead under 'suspicious circumstances'
130.article_body: Lieutenant Colonel Roman Malyk, the head of Russian President Vladimir Putin's Ukraine mobilisation campaign, has been found dead under 'mysterious circumstances', multiple reports said. The 49-year-old was reportedly found dead near a fence at his home. Russian police, who's started a murder probe, hasn't ruled out suicide with some reports saying Malyk died due to hanging.

131.title: Newly-built Suranjan Das Road in B'luru caves in, second incident in a week
131.article_body: A portion of Bengaluru's recently-built Suranjan Das Road has caved in, affecting traffic enroute to Bagmane Tech Park, DRDO and other workspaces. Officials of Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike blamed heavy rains and said they've already begun fixing the issue. This is the second such incident in Bengaluru in a week after Kundalahalli underpass caved in on October 9.

132.title: Neighbour harassed her, hindered her marriage to another man: Police on Vaishali
132.article_body: Vaishali Takkar, the 29-year-old television actress who committed suicide at her house in Madhya Pradesh's Indore, was being harassed by her neighbour named Rahul, according to police. "She was about to get married to another man, but he hindered that too," Indore ACP M Rahman told ANI. Rahul is absconding and a search to nab him is underway.

133.title: Education in Hindi, mother tongue would stop 'brain drain': Shah
133.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Sunday said that PM Narendra Modi turned "brain drain" into "brain gain" by enabling students to pursue medical and technical education in Hindi and other regional languages. "If education is imparted in their mother tongue, I have complete faith that they will reach great heights across the world," Shah said.

134.title: Hope girls play freely now in U-17 Women's WC: India head coach Dennerby
134.article_body: Indian Under-17 women's football team head coach Thomas Dennerby said he wants his side to start playing freely now as they've nothing to lose in FIFA Under-17 Women's World Cup. Hosts India are already out of the World Cup having lost their first two group matches against the United States (0-8) and Morocco (0-3). India will face Brazil on Monday.

135.title: Mumbai man claims fake CBI officers kidnapped him in July, robbed him of â‚¹50 lakh
135.article_body: A 44-year-old businessman from Mumbai's Goregaon lodged a complaint alleging that he was kidnapped on July 1 by men claiming to be from the CBI, who also robbed â‚¹50 lakh from him. The businessman filed the complaint after Goregaon Police recently arrested four fake CBI officers. He said six to seven men, including one with an â€˜ID cardâ€™, kidnapped him.

136.title: It means the world to me: Parineeti on being appreciated for 'Code...'
136.article_body: Actress Parineeti Chopra said that she's "extremely humbled" with the appreciation that she's getting for her performance in 'Code Name: Tiranga'. "I always wanted to do...action film and now that I'm being appreciated in this avatar, it means the world to me!" she added. Parineeti further said she has always believed in breaking the mould and in doing something new.

137.title: Pune Police uses dating app to nab woman accused of drugging dates
137.article_body: Pune Police used a dating app, Bumble, to nab a 27-year-old woman accused of drugging and robbing her dates in the city. The police tried tracing her through the app by making multiple profiles and some of them even matched with her, but she did not initiate any conversation. The woman had robbed 16 people in the last few months.

138.title: 2 Thane people cheat Hyd-based manufacturer of â‚¹18.25 lakh, booked
138.article_body: Two Thane people have been booked for allegedly cheating a Hyderabad-based manufacturer of hygiene products of â‚¹18.25 lakh, police said on Sunday. The accused placed an order for adult diapers worth the aforementioned amount and asked the victim to supply the same to their godown In Bhiwandi. The accused didn't pay after receiving the consignment, an official said.

139.title: Software engineer loses â‚¹6.33 lakh in online dating fraud in Thane
139.article_body: A 48-year-old software engineer allegedly lost â‚¹6.33 lakh in an online dating fraud in Maharashtra's Thane, police said. The man had received a message from a number offering online dating. When he called the number, the accused made him allegedly pay â‚¹6,33,626 on some pretext or other. Meanwhile, police have registered a case and launched an investigation into the matter.

140.title: Giant python found stuck in school bus engine in Raebareli; video surfaces
140.article_body: A massive python was found in the engine of a school bus in Uttar Pradesh's Raebareli area on Sunday. In a video that has surfaced on social media, a man can be seen pulling the snake from the bottom of the bus with the help of a rope. The snake was rescued and no injuries were reported.

141.title: PMC asks Metro officials to repair roads damaged due to metro work
141.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) Commissioner Vikram Kumar asked Metro officials to repair potholes on city roads where metro construction is underway. Kumar also suggested that the Pune Metropolitan Region Development Authority should repair the damaged roads. Additional Municipal Commissioner Kunal Khemnar said that there is traffic congestion in the city due to various developmental works.

142.title: Vietnam's VinFast recalls a third of EVs it sold to replace sensors
142.article_body: Vietnamese EV-maker VinFast on Saturday said it would recall 730 of its model VF e34 EVs to make checks and replace their side crash sensors. "The side crash sensor...is likely to encounter an incompatibility error with the airbag controller...and...may send an incorrect signal to the controller," VinFast said. The firm has sold 2,208 EVs since its launch late last year.

143.title: Police constable shoots himself to death in Chhattisgarh
143.article_body: A police constable allegedly died by suicide by shooting himself with his service weapon at a police camp in Domikala village in Chhattisgarh's Mohla-Manpur-Ambagarh Chowki district on Sunday. The exact reason behind the death is yet to be ascertained, police said. The deceased, Vedram Raj, was a native of the Bilaspur district and his family lives in the Rajnandgaon district.

144.title: AIMIM's UP Prez booked for alleged remark against Hindu marriages
144.article_body: A case has been registered against AIMIM UP President Shaukat Ali for "disturbing communal harmony". During a private event, Ali allegedly said, "Yes, when we (Muslims) marry twice...you (Hindus) marry one woman and keep three mistresses that no one knows about." The police said strict action will be taken against any person making statements that disturb religious harmony.

145.title: Car falls off road in Uttarakhand's Tehri Garhwal; 2 killed
145.article_body: Two men were killed when their car fell off a mountain road in the Kandisaur area of the Tehri Garhwal district in Uttarakhand. The car fell nearly 200 metres down the Nagun-Suwakholi motor road late on Saturday night, an official said. The deceased, Akhil Bisht (28) and Ankit Rawat (25), were residents of the Uttarkashi district, he added.

146.title: 2,400-kg ganja tucked in drums seized by Assam Police, CM shares pics
146.article_body: The Assam Police seized 2,400 kg of ganja tucked inside drums from a truck along the Assam-Tripura border late on Saturday night. Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma tweeted on the same and said, "Two accused apprehended. Excellent work." A few days earlier, Assam Police had seized 9.47 kg of heroin in Karimganj district and arrested one local.

147.title: Attempts to impose Hindi are impractical: Tamil Nadu CM writes to PM
147.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin on Sunday wrote a letter to PM Narendra Modi and said, "The aggressive attempts of the Union government to impose Hindi are impractical and divisive in character." Stalin added that the number of people speaking languages other than Hindi is numerically more than Hindi-speaking people in the Indian Union.

148.title: An editor once wrote that I mix my period blood in ladoos that I send on Diwali: Kangana
148.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut took to Instagram Stories to recall the time when she was called a witch. "In 2016...one of the leading print editors wrote a piece...that her investigative [journalistic] skills...landed her proofs of my black magic skills and she's more than sure...I mix my period blood in ladoos that I send on Diwali to everyone as gifts," Kangana wrote.

149.title: Impressed with his action, Rohit asks 11-year-old boy to bowl to him; video goes viral
149.article_body: A video has gone viral showing Team India captain Rohit Sharma asking an 11-year-old boy named Drushil Chauhan to bowl to him. Team India Analyst Hari Prasad Mohan revealed Drushil's smooth action caught everyone's attention at Perth's WACA stadium when around 100 kids were playing there and Rohit identified him. Drushil bowled to Rohit and also got his autography.

150.title: World can't afford India to follow China's manufacturing path: Raghuram Rajan
150.article_body: Former RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan in a recent speech batted for a services-led export model for India, instead of following China's manufacturing-led export model. "Export-led services growth will be much less environmentally harmful â€“ the world cannot afford India to follow China's path, even if it were open to it," he added.

151.title: Randeep Hooda lost 18 kg to play Savarkar, wanted to lose more: Producer
151.article_body: 'SwatantryaVeer Savarkar' producer Anand Pandit revealed that actor Randeep Hooda lost 18 kg to play the role of freedom fighter Vinayak Damodar Savarkar. "He wanted to shed a few more to look the part. We discussed the idea of making him look leaner in the post-production, but eventually decided to go with his decision," he added.

152.title: Italian insulted PM, now Italia insults his mother: Anurag Thakur
152.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur said an "Italian woman" used to "insult" PM Modi and now an "Italia" is insulting his mother, in a reported reference to Sonia Gandhi and AAP leader Gopal Italia. "Gujarat did not accept this insult earlier, it will not accept it now," added Thakur. He said the BJP was going to win 400-plus seats in 2024.

153.title: People at God's mercy in UP, will be called baaghi if we raise voice: BJP MP
153.article_body: BJP MP from UP's Kaiserganj, Brijbhushan Sharan Singh, said people in areas affected by flooding have been left "bhagwan bharose (at god's mercy)". Singh said he couldn't express how he felt for fear of being labelled a "baaghi (rebel)" and that there wasn't any scope for criticism anymore. Never saw such poor preparations for flood control and relief, Singh added.

154.title: About 3,000 mangroves to be saved by removing bunds in Navi Mumbai
154.article_body: The Maharashtra Forest Department has begun removing manmade bunds (embankments) that were blocking water flow to mangroves in Navi Mumbai. This will reportedly save around 3,000 mangroves. "Work at Kamothe was completed. At Kharghar, the periphery was cleared by an excavator, four staffers and four labourers, partially restoring tidal water flow. A large portion still remains," said an official.

155.title: Jaya Bachchan tells media person 'I hope you fall'; video surfaces
155.article_body: A video has surfaced on the internet showing actress and politician Jaya Bachchan telling a media person, who reportedly took a tumble, "Serves you well. I hope you...fall." The video also showed her asking the paparazzi, "Who are you? From media house do you belong to?" The video was reportedly taken at the Lakme Fashion Week in Mumbai.

156.title: Got validation as actress after working with Big B, Aamir, Dhanush: AvrRam
156.article_body: Elli AvrRam has said that she got validation as an actress after working with "critically-acclaimed actors" like Aamir Khan, Dhanush and Amitabh Bachchan. Speaking about featuring in Amitabh's film 'Goodbye', AvrRam said, "It feels amazing to get to share the big screen with our legend, Amitabh Bachchan. It's, to be honest, surreal and unbelievable still."

157.title: Donetsk mayor's office hit by Ukrainian shelling: Pro-Russia officials
157.article_body: Ukrainian shelling on Sunday morning damaged the mayor's office in the city of Donetsk, the capital of the Donetsk region, Moscow-backed authorities said. The main entry into the building was hit and several nearby cars were damaged, the authorities added. There were no immediate reports of casualties. Moscow-backed authorities seized control of Donetsk city from Ukraine in 2014.

158.title: Govt owes an answer to India: NCP on fall in global hunger ranking
158.article_body: NCP on Saturday criticised the government after India slipped six places on Global Hunger Index 2022 to take 107th position out of 121 countries ranked. NCP Spokesperson Clyde Crasto said this ranking indicates that the Central government neglected the development of children over the last eight years. "The government owes an answer to India on this sensitive issue," he added.

159.title: Regasa, Cheptai win elite races at Delhi Half Marathon, Sable fastest Indian
159.article_body: Ethiopia's Chala Regasa won the men's elite race at Vedanta Delhi Half Marathon, with a timing of one hour 30 seconds, on Sunday. Kenya's Irene Chepet Cheptai clocked a personal best of 1:06:42 to top the women's event. Steeple-chaser Avinash Sable won the Indian men's elite race by 0.04 seconds ahead of Kartik Kumar. Both Sable and Kartik clocked 1:04:00.

160.title: 2 African nationals cheat women on social media in Hyd; arrested
160.article_body: Hyderabad Cyber Crime Police on Sunday arrested two African nationals from Delhi for allegedly cheating women on social media. One of the accused befriended the victims and told them that he would send gold and electronic gadgets in a parcel. The other accused introduced himself as an official from the customs department and asked the victims to pay customs tax.

161.title: 4 injured after getting electrocuted during Bharat Jodo Yatra in K'taka
161.article_body: Four people participating in Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's Bharat Jodo Yatra sustained injuries after getting electrocuted in Karnataka on Sunday. "Today, an unfortunate incident happened during the yatra when four of our friends got a minor electric shock on account of a pole touching the wire," said Congress' Randeep Singh Surjewala. The injured will be compensated with â‚¹1 lakh.

162.title: Siblings stabbed by 2 drunk men in Delhi's Dwarka; 1 dead
162.article_body: A 33-year-old man was stabbed to death while his brother sustained grievous injuries after they were attacked allegedly by two drunk men in Dwarka, Delhi. The deceased has been identified as Lohit while his brother, Anil (32), is undergoing treatment at a hospital, police said. The accused, Rohin (30) and Varun (25), have been arrested, police added.

163.title: KRK shares video of Hrithik Roshan's 'bald patch', actor's fans react
163.article_body: Film critic Kamaal Rashid Khan aka KRK took to Twitter to share a video from a wedding, where Hrithik Roshan appeared as a guest. A part of the video showed a bald patch on Hrithik's head. "When #HrithikRoshan [forgot] to wear...hair patch," KRK wrote. Several fans defended Hrithik, with one writing, "He went through...brain surgery...Stop making fun of a legend."

164.title: Someone other than Rohit should get role of increasing run-rate: Klusener
164.article_body: Ex-South Africa all-rounder Lance Klusener said India should assign the role of increasing run-rate in powerplay to someone other than Rohit Sharma. "There's no need for Rohit to go faster. He was playing easily fast enough, aggressive enough and well enough...not to have changed," Klusener added. India will open their T20 World Cup 2022 campaign against Pakistan on October 23.

165.title: China will enact policies to boost birth rates: Xi at CCP meet
165.article_body: China will implement policies to boost its birth rates and "pursue a proactive national strategy in response to population ageing", President Xi Jinping said at the opening of the CCP's 20th National Congress on Sunday. According to demographers, China is set to register record-low births this year. Last year, China saw an 11.5% drop in births in comparison to 2020

166.title: Congress would win over 150 Assembly seats in K'taka polls: Shivakumar
166.article_body: Karnataka Congress President DK Shivakumar exuded confidence that the party would win the state Assembly elections and claimed that it would get over 150 seats. "Our people are suffering economically. The youngsters are suffering without jobs. The kids, farmers and women are all meeting us. They are coming to Rahul Gandhi and telling [him] about their grievances," said Shivakumar.

167.title: Man brutally thrashed in Bhiwandi on suspicion of being a child-lifter
167.article_body: A man was brutally beaten up by locals on suspicion of being a child lifter in Bhiwandi near Mumbai. A video of the incident surfaced online. Reports said that the man entered a house and was talking to a young boy when locals caught him and started beating him after suspecting that he was a child lifter.

168.title: Tripura forest department to use radio collars to track elephant movement
168.article_body: As a part of its efforts to reduce man-animal conflicts, Tripura forest department decided to use GPS-enabled devices to track elephants' movement, Deputy Chief Wildlife Warden KG Roy said. A Bengaluru-based company has been entrusted with the task of fitting radio collars around the neck of elephants. At least 50 incidents of man-elephant conflict were recorded in Tripura since 2019.

169.title: Warner will definitely play vs NZ, not sure about warm-up vs India: Finch
169.article_body: Australia T20I captain Aaron Finch has said opener David Warner is unlikely to play against India in their warm-up match on Monday in the 2022 T20 World Cup. "I think Warner will definitely be right for New Zealand," added Finch. Warner suffered whiplash (a neck injury) in the second England T20I after he landed awkwardly while attempting a catch.

170.title: World no. 1 Swiatek reaches her 9th final of 2022 at San Diego Open
170.article_body: World number one Iga Swiatek reached her ninth final of the season after beating fourth-seeded Jessie Pegula 4-6, 6-2, 6-2 in San Diego Open semi-final. This is the 21-year-old's 63rd win of 2022. Swiatek will become the fourth woman to finish the year with more than 10,000 points in WTA Tour rankings, after Victoria Azarenka, Maria Sharapova and Serena Williams.

171.title: Muslim man in B'luru arrested in first case under K'taka anti-conversion law
171.article_body: A Muslim man in Bengaluru has been arrested in the first case under Karnataka Protection of Right to Freedom of Religion Act. The case was filed on October 6 over a complaint by a 19-year-old girl's mother that her daughter was converted to another religion by the accused on pretext of marriage. The girl had gone missing on October 5.

172.title: John announces wrap on 'Tehran', calls it 'wonderful experience'
172.article_body: Actor John Abraham took to Instagram to share that shooting of his film 'Tehran' has been completed. "Thank you to the entire team for making it such a wonderful shoot experience. Can't wait to bring this one to you," he wrote. The action-thriller film, directed by Arun Gopalan, will be released in 2023. It also stars Manushi Chhillar.

173.title: People are finally recognising us: 'Kantara' director on Kannada cinema
173.article_body: 'Kantara' director Rishab Shetty said people are "finally recognising" the Kannada film industry, and he credits the success of films like 'KGF', which "created a new path for the filmmakers" to explore. Rishab said Kantara's success proves that the audience has started looking at cinema from a different perspective. "The entire world accepted the film so wonderfully," Rishab added.

174.title: AAP has broken records of corruption set by Congress: JP Nadda
174.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda claimed that the AAP government has become synonymous with scams and has broken the records of corruption set by the Congress. "The AAP has become a party of scams...It needs to be packed off lock, stock and barrel," said Nadda. He also stated that the BJP will trounce the AAP in the MCD polls.

175.title: AAP has broken records of corruption set by Congress: Nadda
