"I was also told that I looked like her and then slowly I started imitating her," she added. "Thankfully, wisdom came knocking one day and I was like what am I doing? There can't be another Sridevi, so stop it," Shefali further said.

349.title: Bhuvneshwar is still the go-to guy for Rohit Sharma: Suresh Raina
349.article_body: Ex-Indian cricketer Suresh Raina said that seamer Bhuvneshwar Kumar is still the go-to guy for skipper Rohit Sharma. "Bhuvneshwar is an experienced bowler...Sometimes you go for runs, but he still has that swing," Raina said. He added, "When Virat [Kohli] scored a hundred, [Bhuvneshwar] also took five wickets against Afghanistan...He has that knuckleball, swing and he hits areas well."

350.title: 18-yr-old NEET aspirant dies of liver disease in Raj, 35 other students ill
350.article_body: An 18-year-old NEET aspirant, who was diagnosed with severe liver disease, died during treatment at a private hospital in Rajasthan's Kota, an official said on Saturday. The victim was among 36 students, who were suffering from the disease. Kota CMHO said three water suppliers in the area were found to be supplying contaminated drinking water to coaching institutes and canteens.

351.title: Just stuck to basics and got rewards: Renuka on 3/5 in Asia Cup final
351.article_body: India pacer Renuka Singh said she's happy to be named 'Player of the Match' in India's eight-wicket win against Sri Lanka in Women's Asia Cup 2022 final. Renuka posted bowling figures of 3-1-5-3. "In...last few games, I didn't bowl well. I practised with my coach...staff and got better. I didn't try anything, just stuck to...basics and got rewards," she added.

352.title: Waited for 12-14 hrs for Kareena during my debut film's shoot: Tusshar
352.article_body: Tusshar Kapoor, speaking on the insider versus outsider debate, said that a "red carpet" is not laid out for every star kid. "While shooting for my debut film, 'Mujhe Kucch Kehna Hai', I'd to wait for...co-star and another star kid Kareena Kapoor...for 12-14 hours as she was simultaneously working on four films," he said, adding he considers himself an outsider.

353.title: Immediately starting work on gas hub proposed by Russia: Turkey
353.article_body: Turkish and Russian officials have been told to immediately start technical work on a proposed natural gas hub in Turkey, President Recep Erdogan has said. Russian President Vladimir Putin had earlier proposed that this hub could sell gas "to third countries, especially in Europe". The proposal aims to export more gas through the TurkStream gas pipeline.

354.title: Video shows UP policeman stealing bulb from shop; suspended
354.article_body: Sub-inspector Rajesh Verma from Uttar Pradesh Police was suspended after a video of him stealing a bulb from outside a shop went viral. The video shows Verma discreetly looking around before removing the bulb. He then puts it in his pocket and walks away. Defending himself, Verma said he removed the bulb as it was dark where he was stationed.

355.title: 5 drug peddlers booked under PSA in J&K's Budgam district
355.article_body: Five alleged drug peddlers were booked under the Public Safety Act (PSA) in J&K's Budgam district, police said on Saturday. The PSA was invoked against the accused after obtaining sanctions from the competent authority, as per the police. The accused were involved in 12 cases registered under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances (NDPS) Act across central Kashmir, police added.

356.title: Kashmir Freedom Fighters claims responsibility for killing Kashmiri Pandit in J&K
356.article_body: Hours after Puran Krishan Bhat, a Kashmiri Pandit, died after being shot in Jammu and Kashmir's Shopian district on Saturday, terror outfit Kashmir Freedom Fighters has claimed responsibility for the killing, police said. Bhat was on his way to an orchard in Chowdari Gund when he was fired upon. Police said they are ascertaining the reason behind the killing.

357.title: Mistakes were made: New UK Finance Minister on recent tax cuts
357.article_body: UK's new Finance Minister Jeremy Hunt on Saturday said his predecessor had made some "mistakes", referring to the tax cuts announced last month. "We will have some very difficult decisions ahead," Hunt said. His predecessor Kwasi Kwarteng was sacked by Prime Minister Liz Truss on Friday, after less than six weeks on the job.

358.title: Illegal property of 2 drug peddlers demolished in Haryana's Fatehabad
358.article_body: The district authorities on Saturday demolished an illegally built house of two drug peddler brothers in Haryana's Fatehabad. "Both the brothers were booked in 14 cases under...NDPS Act," Jakhal Police Station SHO Jai Bhagwan said. "One week ago, the municipal committee officials had served notice to the family of these peddlers asking them to vacate the house," SHO added.

359.title: Which are the best & worst-performing countries as per latest global hunger rankings?
359.article_body: Seventeen countries have shared the top rank in the Global Hunger Index 2022, including China, Belarus, Turkey, Chile, Croatia, Estonia, Hungary and Kuwait. These countries got a score of less than five on the index. Among the worst-performing nations is Yemen (ranked last at 121st position) followed by the Central African Republic, Madagascar, the Democratic Republic of Congo, Chad etc.

360.title: 2 killed in road accident in Jharkhand's Dumka district
360.article_body: Two people were killed following a collision between a motorcycle and a truck carrying stone chips in Jharkhand's Dumka district on Saturday, police said. Another person was critically injured in the accident that took place on a stretch of the Dumka-Rampurhat national highway near Simluti village, police added. The deceased include a man and a woman, as per a doctor.

361.title: Woman sedated at house party, gang-raped by guests in Pune
361.article_body: A woman, who had arranged a house party at her residence in Pune on October 9, was reportedly gang-raped by her guests. The woman claimed that after the party, she went to her room to rest, following which the accused entered the room, sprayed sedatives on her and raped her. Police have arrested two persons in the case.

362.title: Wasim Jaffer shares 'Kota Factory' meme to react to Rohit, Babar hugging each other
362.article_body: Former India batter Wasim Jaffer took to Twitter to react to pictures of Team India captain Rohit Sharma and Pakistan captain Babar Azam hugging each other during a photoshoot ahead of T20 World Cup 2022. Reacting to the picture, he shared a meme from the first season of 'Kota Factory', which read, "Kitna parivarik mahol hai (What a familial atmosphere)."

363.title: I am going to 'mankad' someone next year: Rajasthan Royals' Riyan Parag
363.article_body: Rajasthan Royals all-rounder Riyan Parag took to Twitter and stated that he's going to "mankad" someone next year, adding, "It is going to create a fun Twitter debate." Reacting to his tweet, a user wrote, "What if you don't get a chance to be in playing XI?" Parag responded, "Some positivity please...sir." "Ashwin will definitely support you," a fan wrote.

364.title: Wasn't able to perform my duties: Boora Narsaiah Goud after quitting TRS
364.article_body: Former TRS MP Boora Narsaiah Goud, after resigning from the party, alleged that he was not able to perform his duties and was not consulted on the decision to start Bharat Rashtra Samithi (BRS). "I didn't criticise the CM in my resignation letter," Goud said. "I've been through a lot of pain while separating from this family (TRS)," he added.

365.title: Really poor from you: Badani on Starc taking Deepti's name while giving 'mankad' warning
365.article_body: Reacting to a video of Australia pacer Mitchell Starc giving 'mankad' warning to England's Jos Buttler by saying, "I'm not Deepti, but I won't do it",  ex-India cricketer Hemang Badani tweeted, "Grow up Starc...That's really poor from you." He added, "If you only want to warn...non-striker...that's fine...but you bringing Deepti into this isn't what the cricket world expects of you."

366.title: Indian Army signs MoUs with 11 banks for Agniveer Salary Package
366.article_body: The Indian Army has signed Memorandums of Understanding (MoUs) with 11 banks for providing banking facilities to Agniveers under the Agniveer Salary Package. The MoUs were signed with banks including State Bank of India, Punjab National Bank, Bank of Baroda and ICICI Bank. The first batch of Agniveers on enrolment under the 'Agnipath Scheme' will join training centres by January.

367.title: 22-year-old student's body found in drain near Noida college
367.article_body: The body of a 22-year-old student was found in a drain near Galgotias University in Greater Noida on Saturday. The student had been missing since October 12. His family alleged that five students killed him after a fight. There are no apparent injuries on the body of the deceased, said the police. The body has been sent for post-mortem.

368.title: No action by PM on K'taka govt corruption allegation: Siddaramaiah
368.article_body: Congress leader Siddaramaiah said PM Narendra Modi took no action on the letter sent to him by a contractors association accusing the state government of charging 40% commission on public work. "Where are you, Mr Narendra Modi?... Aren't you ashamed?" asked Siddaramaiah. He added that the BJP's only contribution in Karnataka's Ballari was looting natural resources by the mining barons.

369.title: Bodies of 2 children recovered from well in Gujarat; mother missing
369.article_body: The bodies of two minor siblings, whose mother is missing, were recovered from a well in Gujarat's Jamnagar. Police have launched a search operation to trace the missing woman. A case of accidental death was registered after the children's bodies were found. Police suspect the woman may have thrown her five-year-old and three-month-old children in the well.

370.title: 4 including ex-BSP leader's 3 sons booked in gang-rape case in UP
370.article_body: Four people, including three sons of former BSP MLC and mining mafia Haji Iqbal, have been booked in connection with a gang-rape case in Uttar Pradesh, a senior police officer said on Saturday. Iqbal is absconding while his sons are already in jail in different cases, the officer added. The fourth accused was arrested on Saturday.

371.title: Nothing to criticise about Khushi's work in 'The Archies': Boney Kapoor
371.article_body: After watching the teaser of daughter Khushi Kapoor's debut film 'The Archies', producer Boney Kapoor said, "There was nothing to criticise as it was amazing." "We discussed the good points as those were the only things I could see. The same happens when I see Janhvi's films," he added. He also said that Khushi usually doesn't discuss work with him.

372.title: Nadal doesn't look great playing, Federer is smooth, very elegant: Tyson
372.article_body: Boxing legend Mike Tyson has said he's a big fan of Roger Federer, adding when the 20-time Grand Slam champion was in his prime, he was always moving in the air. "Rafael Nadal was just all over the place. He's a great player, but he doesn't look great playing. Federer is smooth and very elegant," he further said.

373.title: Prescribe medicines in Hindi, write Shri Hari on top: MP CM Chouhan
373.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan asked why prescriptions cannot be written in Hindi and said doctors should "write Shri Hari on the top and the names of medicines below". He said the government was not against English but awareness about the official language is necessary. He said Indians had become "slaves" to the English language.

374.title: Kerala govt opposes ED plea seeking transfer of gold smuggling case
374.article_body: Kerala government has filed an affidavit in the SC opposing the ED's plea seeking the transfer of trial in the Kerala gold smuggling case to Karnataka. After completion of the investigation and evidence collection, and submission of a supplementary complaint, ED cannot seek transfer of the case merely on the ground of alleged interference by state police, the government argued.

375.title: Arjun Rampal, girlfriend Gabriella to star in 'Project Love': Reports
375.article_body: Actor Arjun Rampal has signed on to star in an upcoming comic caper, titled 'Project Love', according to reports. It will reportedly also feature the actor's girlfriend Gabriella Demetriades. As per reports, the story revolves around a brother who decides to make a plan to kidnap his sister in order to save her from her boyfriend who is an opportunist.

376.title: No unparliamentary language used to question PM's caste: JD(U) chief
376.article_body: JD(U) President Lalan Singh defended his remarks on PM Modi's caste and said he did not use any "unparliamentary language". "What will you call someone who...tries to mislead people by furnishing wrong facts?" asked Singh. He had said that PM Modi claimed to be from the extremely backward class in 2014 even though "Gujarat has no EBC category".

377.title: Patient plays saxophone while undergoing brain surgery in Italy, video surfaces
377.article_body: A musician in Italy who underwent a "very, very complex" brain surgery to remove a tumour, played his saxophone during the nine-hour procedure. The 35-year-old man underwent the 'awake surgery', allowing doctors to check his speech and motor skills to ensure they haven't been damaged. A video showed him playing 'Love Story' movie theme song and the Italian national anthem.

378.title: Jaya says grandson Agastya watches 'Kabhi Khushi...' to make fun of her
378.article_body: Veteran actress Jaya Bachchan, in an episode of her granddaughter Navya Naveli Nanda's podcast 'What The Hell Navya', revealed that her grandson Agastya Nanda watches 'Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham' to "make fun" of her in it. The Karan Johar directorial was released in 2001. Agastya is all set to make his acting debut with Zoya Akhtar's upcoming 'The Archies'.

379.title: Murder probe launched after girl's body found in a trunk in Paris
379.article_body: A murder investigation was launched on Saturday following the recovery of a 12-year-old girl's body from a trunk outside her family's building in Paris. According to French media, surveillance footage shows the girl entering the building's lobby at 3 pm (local time) on Friday. Cameras also reportedly show a woman dragging a trunk with some difficulty later in the day.

380.title: My grandfather always told me tennis was boxing at 90 ft: Jimmy Connors
380.article_body: Jimmy Connors revealed that his grandfather trained him as a boxer as part of his tennis training. "My grandfather was a boxer...He always told me...tennis was boxing at 90 feet. Because you had to learn how to take...blows and come back from it," he added. With 109 titles, Connors holds the record for most men's singles titles in Open Era.

381.title: ED raids coaching centre of TMC MLA Manik Bhattacharya's aide
381.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Saturday raided a coaching centre owned by Tapas Mondal, a close aide of TMC MLA Manik Bhattacharya, in West Bengal. The raid was conducted in connection with the alleged state SSC recruitment scam case. Bhattacharya was arrested on Tuesday for alleged irregularities in teachers' appointments. He's the ex-President of West Bengal Board of Primary Education.

382.title: Why does India's T20 World Cup 2022 jersey have just one star on it?
382.article_body: India's T20 World Cup 2022 jersey has only one star on it instead of the usual three stars on India's limited-over jersey. The three stars represent India's World Cup wins: 1983 ODI World Cup, 2007 T20 World Cup and 2011 ODI World Cup. The solitary star for the T20 World Cup 2022 represents just India's 2007 T20 World Cup win.

383.title: ICC releases list of 10 records that could be smashed at T20 World Cup 2022
383.article_body: The ICC has released a list of 10 records that could be smashed at T20 World Cup 2022, which begins in Australia tomorrow. The records include Mahela Jayawardena's record for scoring most runs in T20 WC history (1,016), Chris Gayle's record for slamming most T20 WC centuries (two), Virat Kohli's record for registering most scores of 50+ in T20 WC.

384.title: When have we shown aggression?: Imran Khan as US Prez calls Pakistan 'dangerous'
384.article_body: Former Pakistan PM Imran Khan raised questions over the remarks of US President Joe Biden after the latter called Pakistan "one of the most dangerous nations in the world". "On what info has [US President] reached this unwarranted conclusion?" asked Khan. "Unlike the US which has been involved in wars [globally]...when has Pakistan shown aggression, especially post-nuclearisation?" he added.

385.title: AAP, others file complaints against BJP candidate for Adampur bypoll
385.article_body: Adampur bypoll candidates from AAP, INLD and three others filed separate complaints with Haryana's Chief Electoral Officer against BJP's nominee Bhavya Bishnoi. The complainants alleged that Bishnoi hid the details of three out of four cases being investigated by the ED against him. The Returning Officer has reportedly said Bishnoi did not hide any fact in his submissions.

386.title: BJP became world's largest party due of leaders like Madan Lal Khurana: Nadda
386.article_body: BJP chief JP Nadda on Saturday said the party has become the world's largest political party because of leaders like Madan Lal Khurana who never wavered from their ideology and commitment towards people. Nadda asked party leaders and workers to learn from Khurana's life. Khurana was involved in numerous political struggles and provided solutions to different issues, Nadda added.

387.title: Telangana's Nalgonda Congress leader Palle Ravi Kumar joins TRS
387.article_body: Nalgonda Congress leader Palle Ravi Kumar and his wife, Chandur MPP Jyothi, joined TRS on Saturday in the presence of the party's working president KT Rama Rao in Hyderabad. Ravi Kumar was among those trying for a chance as Congress candidate for the Munugode by-election. His brother, Palle Vinod, has filed his nomination as a candidate for Telangana Jana Samithi.

388.title: After 'Delhi Crime 2', my son said I've become like Iron Man: Shefali Shah
388.article_body: Actress Shefali Shah revealed that after 'Delhi Crime 2', her son told her that she has become like Iron Man. "He shared...every Marvel superhero has been played by various actors except Iron Man...you've become like that. You cannot be replaced," she said. "I was so touched that I wanted to print and put it on the walls," Shefali added.

389.title: 2 Arunachal youths go missing from near China border; search op underway
389.article_body: Two youths in Arunachal Pradesh have been reported missing for almost two months after they had ventured near the state's border with China in search of medicinal plants. "Their family members lodged missing complaints before the police on October 9," Anjaw SP Rike Kamsi said. "We have contacted the Army and our search and rescue operations are underway," Kamsi added.

390.title: We don't really have a choice in what people call us: NZ skipper Williamson
390.article_body: Showing no concern about the lack of favourites tag for New Zealand at upcoming T20 World Cup, captain Kane Williamson said his side doesn't really have a choice in what people call them. He added that the team will try and focus on the cricket that they want to play. New Zealand finished as runners-up at T20 World Cup 2021.

391.title: One can become Sub-Inspector in K'taka by paying â‚¹80 lakh: Rahul
391.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi on Saturday claimed that if people have money, they can buy a government job in Karnataka. "If you want to be Police Sub-Inspector, you can be one by paying â‚¹80 lakh," he added. Calling the state government a "40% commission" government, he questioned why 2.5 lakh government posts were lying vacant in the BJP-ruled state.

392.title: Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' is meaningless: K'taka CM Bommai
392.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Saturday said the Congress is relaunching its "failed missile" Rahul Gandhi through 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', but the entire exercise is meaningless. "Already, the country has been marching ahead as a united India," the Karnataka CM said. "India is united, and it is making rapid progress on the international level," Bommai added.

393.title: All 4 will die: Man in live Facebook video before BMW hit truck at 230 kmph in UP
393.article_body: Four persons were killed on the Purvanchal Expressway in Sultanpur, Uttar Pradesh. A BMW car that was going at a high speed of 230 kmph had rammed into a container truck. The occupants of the BMW were doing a Facebook Live, with the camera focused on the speedometer. A man can be heard saying, "All four will die."

394.title: Will never forget smell of cigars & beard glue: Rupert on Robbie's demise
394.article_body: Actor Rupert Grint, who played Ron Weasley in the 'Harry Potter' films, took to Instagram to share a post mourning the demise of Robbie Coltrane, who portrayed Hagrid. "I'll never forget the smell of cigars and beard glue - a wonderful combination," he wrote. "[He was]...a giant-hearted man who was still looking out for us even decades later," Rupert added.

395.title: Judicial delay is a major challenge facing the people: PM Modi
395.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi said delay in getting justice is one of the main challenges being faced by the people. He made the comment in a video message aired at the 'All India Conference of Law Ministers and Law Secretaries' in Kevadia, Gujarat on Saturday. Modi said new laws should be written lucidly so that they are easy to understand.

396.title: Delhi govt launches 6 scholarship programmes for 2022-23
396.article_body: The Delhi Department for Welfare of SC/ST/OBC/Minorities said six scholarship programmes for students of classes XII and below have been launched for the 2022-2023 academic year. Under the programme, the government will reimburse tuition fees of selected students. The department has issued guidelines to all heads of schools regarding the programmes.

397.title: Petrol tanker overturns after crash in UP, hundreds loot petrol; video goes viral
397.article_body: A video has gone viral showing hundreds of local people looting petrol after a petrol tanker overturned in Uttar Pradesh's Aligarh district. The tanker overturned after crashing into a truck following which petrol fell into a ditch. In the video, locals can be seen filling buckets and utensils with petrol.

398.title: Divine spirit attached to film made it a hit: Rishab on Kantara's success
398.article_body: Rishab Shetty, who wrote and directed the Kannada film 'Kantara' in addition to acting in it, spoke about the film's success and said that the "divine spirit and energy attached to the film has made it a blockbuster today". "Also, the people of Karnataka who've promoted the film...and the pride they feel is the reason behind...success of Kantara," he added.

399.title: Mahagathbandhan flag will fly at Centre: Bihar minister Tej Pratap
399.article_body: Bihar minister Tej Pratap Yadav said that the Opposition will replace BJP in the 2024 Lok Sabha polls. "Public has rejected the BJP government in Bihar...Last time, I had predicted about Chachaji (Bihar CM Nitish Kumar), today he is with us," Yadav said. He added, "Today, I predict that the flag of Mahagathbandhan will fly at the Centre."

400.title: Vistara to start Pune-Singapore direct flights from December
400.article_body: Vistara airlines will start direct flights between Pune and Singapore from December 2. "As an introductory offer, the all-inclusive Pune-Singapore-Pune round trip will cost â‚¹17,799 for economy," said Chief Executive Officer of Vistara, Vinod Kannan. The flight will leave Pune on Mondays, Wednesdays, Fridays and Sundays at 02:10 hours and reach Singapore at 10:30 hours.

401.title: Incorrect measure of hunger: Govt as India falls 6 places on Global Hunger Index
401.article_body: The government issued a statement as the World Hunger Index ranked India at 107th position among 121 countries, six places below last year. "The index is an erroneous measure of hunger and suffers from serious methodological issues," said the government. The Global Hunger Report is 'misinformed' and "disconnected from ground reality", it added, while raising questions over the indicators used.

402.title: Om Prakash Bakoria appointed Chairman & Managing Director of PMPML
402.article_body: Om Prakash Bakoria has been appointed as the Chairman and Managing Director of Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited (PMPML). Bakoria earlier served as the Additional Municipal Commissioner of the Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC). In the PMC, Bakoria was involved in several key decisions related to the public transport services, officials said.
